Frohnhofer, Jim wrote:

> Maybe I don't get this.  This appears to be abuse of junit.

I don't know about /that/... if you mean he's doing something JUnit 
wasn't built for, then I agree. I guess that's "abuse" if one uses the 
term clinically. :)

> To me it seems extremely unlikely that you truly require one million tests.
> Without knowing further details about your project, I can't offer any
> specific ideas about where you've gone wrong, but have you considered
> putting the iterator inside the test?

I would agree. If you're running up against memory constraints, then you 
have to either make more memory available or use less memory. One way to 
use less memory is to place the iterator inside a test*() method, to 
avoid creating 10^6 Test objects. I prefer test isolation, but if I'm 
forced to do things another way, I eventually give in.
